channel.title: Spring JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [SPR-963] JdbcTemplate.queryForRowSet only works with Java 1.5
item.description:
When executing JdbcTemplate queryForRowSet method, a NoClassDefFoundError excpetion is thrown for javax.sql.rowset.CachedRowSet, which is part of Java 1.5. The javadoc for the method states that results will be mapped to an SqlRowSet which is a wrapper class for javax.sql.RowSet. However, it also implies that it could possibly wrap javax.sql.rowset.CachedRowSet, which seems to be the case.

java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: javax/sql/rowset/CachedRowSet

at org.pirate.spring.jdbc.PirateDAO.getFlagsRecentlyUpdated(PirateDAO.java:282)

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
Actually, queryForRowSet does not require JDK 1.5 itself but rather Sun's "JDBC RowSet Implementations", which are included out-of-the-box in JDK 1.5. However, they can also be downloaded individually from "http://java.sun.com/products/jdbc", as "rowset.jar". You can also find that jar in the "lib/j2ee" directory of the Spring distribution.

I'll make that clear in the javadoc. Obviously this isn't mentioned anywhere outside "lib/readme.txt".

Juergen

It actually is mentioned in the javadoc of SqlRowSetResultSetExtractor, which JdbcTemplate delegates to for extracting SqlRowSets. I'll mention it in the JdbcOperations/JdbcTemplate javadoc too.

Juergen
